instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins No Chime USB Mouse Blinking
threads.message:
This is a liquid dmaged only in <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> area.  Replaced <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and fan spins chimed and USB light presents.
When the board keep or couple of minutes and turn on again fan spins no chime usb mouse light blinking.
bios area is fine and replced the bios with new reprogrammed bios. 

What I released even when you heat  a tiny bit near bios and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> area chime and light on the usb. again when the board cool down same situation.
Check all the resistors traces and replaced <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> , <CAPACITOR>C6101</CAPACITOR> still no luck.

Any advice greatly appricaite.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins No Chime USB Mouse Blinking
threads.message:
Heat reaction points to accumulated crap underneath PCH/CPU.
Use quality flux and heat untill 180-200 degrees.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins No Chime USB Mouse Blinking
threads.message:
Hi 2info, that worked. Again thank you very much. By the way for some reason I cant access to 4 years old my previous forum account. Had to create new one.

Thanks again
